gui

Class SimulatorController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.SimulatorController

  • public class SimulatorController
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimulatorController()
      Simulator Controller constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPackage()
      Adds a Polygon representing a Packing Station according to the "SIM" file.
      void addPane()
      Adds a stack pane to every node in the grid.
      void addRobots()
      Adds a Circle representing a Robot and a Rectangle representing a Charging Pod according to the "SIM" file.
      void addStorage()
      Adds a Polygon representing a Storage Shelf according to the "SIM" file.
      void closePressed()
      Sends the user an alert, letting them know that they are about to leave the simulation; once they click 'OK'.
      void endSimulationPressed() 
      void initialize()
      Set-up the Simulation GUI, by setting up the Grid and Entities present in it.
      void move(int i)
      Iterates through a HashMap on current locations and next locations, updating the GUI and the model.
      void moveRobot(int i, java.awt.Point current, java.awt.Point next)
      Moves the Robot displayed on the GUI to the next location.
      void oneTickPressed()
      Executes cost estimation and the move method, for each Robot and increase the step the simulation is on.
      void printInfo()
      Updates the information displayed in the sidebars of the GUI.
      void returnPressed()
      When clicked, it returns to the 'set-up' GUI, allowing the user to input other parameters or change the grid.
      void tenTickPressed()
      Calls on the oneTickPressed method 10 times and increase the step the GUI is on, by 10.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimulatorController

        public SimulatorController()
        Simulator Controller constructor. Sets the finalGridHeight and the finalGridWidth to values read from the "SIM" file. Initialises the Warehouse to have the same enities and parameters as the one from the "SIM" file. Initialises the the Circle List ArrayList

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Set-up the Simulation GUI, by setting up the Grid and Entities present in it.

      • addPane

        public void addPane()
        Adds a stack pane to every node in the grid.

      • addRobots

        public void addRobots()
        Adds a Circle representing a Robot and a Rectangle representing a Charging Pod according to the "SIM" file. initialize()

      • addStorage

        public void addStorage()
        Adds a Polygon representing a Storage Shelf according to the "SIM" file. initialize()

      • addPackage

        public void addPackage()
        Adds a Polygon representing a Packing Station according to the "SIM" file. initialize()

      • returnPressed

        public void returnPressed()
        When clicked, it returns to the 'set-up' GUI, allowing the user to input other parameters or change the grid.

      • move

        public void move(int i)
        Iterates through a HashMap on current locations and next locations, updating the GUI and the model.
        Parameters:
        i - int, index to move the right Robot

      • moveRobot

        public void moveRobot(int i,
                      java.awt.Point current,
                      java.awt.Point next)
        Moves the Robot displayed on the GUI to the next location.
        Parameters:
        i, - index to move the right circle in the GUI.
        current, - which is the current location of the Robot
        next, - which is the next location of the Robot

      • oneTickPressed

        public void oneTickPressed()
        Executes cost estimation and the move method, for each Robot and increase the step the simulation is on.

      • tenTickPressed

        public void tenTickPressed()
        Calls on the oneTickPressed method 10 times and increase the step the GUI is on, by 10. oneTickPressed()

      • endSimulationPressed

        public void endSimulationPressed()

      • closePressed

        public void closePressed()
        Sends the user an alert, letting them know that they are about to leave the simulation; once they click 'OK'.

      • printInfo

        public void printInfo()
        Updates the information displayed in the sidebars of the GUI.
